We load the cleaned data that is appropriated for random forest algorith: not normalized or seperated into explanatory/response variable .
```{r}
load("../Data/CleanedData.RData")
```

Import necessary library
```{r}
library(randomForest)
library(caret)
```
We run the random forest algorithm without any model tunning.
```{r}
set.seed(12345)
rf <- randomForest(track_popularity ~ ., data = spotify_data)
rf
```

```{r}
ctrl <- trainControl(method = "cv", number = 10,
                     selectionFunction = "oneSE")
grid_rf <- expand.grid(.mtry = c(2, 4, 8, 16))
```

```{r}
set.seed(12345)
spotify_data$track_popularity <- as.factor(spotify_data$track_popularity)
summary(spotify_data$track_popularity)
m_rf <- train(track_popularity ~ ., data = spotify_data, method = "rf",
              metric = "Kappa", trControl = ctrl,
              tuneGrid = grid_rf)
m_rf
```

```{r}
saveRDS(m_rf, "rf_basemodel.rds")
```
